comment: Very nice teacher. His tests and quizzes are very straight forward and simple but if you don't attend class not only will you fail those he includes a major part of your grade as attendance. Listening to his lectures you can tell he is passionate about what he teaches which makes for a great class. I would definitely recommend.
Tons of fun super easy A.

His class is very easy just make sure you go. Tests are very straightforward and he will tell you the questions that will be on it. Weekly homework is very easy. It lets you answer each question until you get it right resulting in 100's every time. His sense of humor is great & makes it worth coming to class. I would recommend him. Take good notes

I am a 3rd year student and prof Bailey has been my favorite teacher I have had yet at kennesaw and even back in high school. I took him for world history as well as American history. The homework is extremely easy to the point that you don't need the text book.  I was heart broken to hear that kennesaw has let go an AMAZING teacher.

He is a little weird, but overall nice guy. However he class is not really easy. He is unclear about the tests (which is basically the only grades). I love history, but his lectures are extremely boring. He does give extra credit (like attendance, which bumped me a letter grade)! He isn't awful, but gets someone else if you can.

Very basic overview of world history occurances. 6 small(about 20-30questions) tests based on a few pages of notes taken (50% of grade).Homework on connect, EASY A (20%) Attendance (10%...5 points deducted per absent). Final (20%) has 93 questions based on your notes, final review given to direct your studies which was close to the actual. Easy B

His class is not easy!!! In the beginning it seems like it will be an easy ride but it will not be. I have 3.5 majoring in Biology and I made a B in his class and that was studying hard! Sometime he was unclear on what to study. You believe you have all the necessary material to study for his test, but you will see differently taking the test.

I'm not sure if he suddenly changed over the semester but the teacher that I have right now is not as easy and helpful as everyone is saying. His quizzes are hard even if you study them. If you don't like history, I wouldn't take this guy.
Best professor I've had!

Mr. Bailey is a great teacher & has a great sense of humor He makes the class very interesting & is very easy to work with. He gives lots of opportunity to succeed. Homework was done online, but you have unlimited times to make a 100. The only bad thing I can say is the homework dates changed often and I ended up missing an assissgnment.

Bailey is an great teacher!! The attendance is mandatory... unless you want to lose 5 points for every missed class. He knows what he's talking about & as long as you take notes, you're golden. The test's are pretty simple... straight from the notes. I would HIGHLY recommend him. Oh & he likes giving a little extra points to people who help him out

He's a great guy! VERY funny! a little disorganized at times which bothered me. try to become his friend and he'll be more inclined to help you. knows his stuff. GO TO CLASS. i could have gotten a B if i had showed up more and been on time. i say use your online resources. Good professor

Prof Bailey is awesome. He is very serious about attendance, but if you do not skip a class,it is easy to pass. The exams are not too difficult, if you review the notes, get an easy A. He has hilarious jokes, I wish I had him on upper level classes.
He is amazing and lets you know exactly what's on the test. Absolutely no surprises unless you just flat out don't study or come to class.

Funny guy, knows his stuff and makes class fun. Don't buy the book, but you'll need the online code for homework. As long as you take good notes and study you'll do fine. Don't miss class unless you have to!

He is a great teacher. He is straight forward and funny. We did not use the book, but definitely took a lot of notes. He will tell you what the test will cover and they are basically easy if you take good notes and study.

He is a really great professor with a lot of knowledge. The most important thing would be to come to class, even though it's not mandatory, because that way you can take notes on everything he says. Thats where most of the test comes from, but he's changing the course for the following semesters so it might be a bit different. Great guy all around.

Professor Bailey is great and informational. We didn't do much in the book, but this will soon change. (Sorry future students) He gives notes that are needed for tests so attendance is mandatory for a good grade. He is helpful and funny; overall great professor.

HILARIOUS!!! As long as you're not sensitive to social issues, i definitely recommend. There are a lot of notes and if you don't come to class you really will suffer. But as long as you're there he'll work with you on grades. An A is no work at all.

Great professor! I recommend anyone who hates or has a hard time with History. He breaks everything down for you so you understand it and doesn't rush to fit 1000 yrs in one semester. Short 10-20 question quiz about every two weeks and then a final. Easy A if you go.
Best professor I've ever had, made class interesting, always asked us how he could improve and then actually used our feedback to be better.. Very nice guy and easy to talk to for help too

I absolutely love Ron Bailey. He makes history interesting and not boring. He is one of the funniest professors I've had. Study what he lectures on and you'll make A's. Don't take advantage of him and email him stupid crap; he will call you out in class! You'll be wishing you were in his family by the time the class is over!

Mr. Bailey is a great history teacher.  He makes the class interesting whether you like history or not. Yes, you have to study your notes but if you study, you shouldn't have a problem making an A in this class.

Must take him! Don't buy the book because whatever he lectures on will be on the test. Every now and then he gives an outline to know what to look for. Keep all tests! attendance not mandatory but it will help* you in the end. His stories are hilarious!

Professor Bailey keeps you interested in the material, and I was never very good at history, but this class was amazing. He has a handful of tests and for the most part they are matching, if you take notes and pay attention you should be fine. KEEP ALL OF YOUR TESTS the last week before finals he tells you whats on the final from the past tests.

He makes history very interesting by teaching with stories. He is hilarious. He gives about 7 small tests, either multiple choice or matching. He is big on dates too. If you just listen to him and take even a few notes you will get a A. Great teacher!

I loved Professor Bailey! I hate history but when he taught, he told the notes like a story and made it a lot more understandable. He's a really nice guy who's really funny and is willing to work with you. If you go to class, take notes and study you'll get an A. I'll definitely be taking my other history courses with Bailey :]
Tests aren't that easy.  Most people do well because they cheat.  He tests on dates and can be wishy washy on topics.  He is funny and nice, though.
He is a funny teacher and knows what he is talking about. He does a lot of little tests instead of a couple big ones, it makes the class easier. Very good teacher and I would take him again.
Easy A if u attent the class daily and take good notes. Very Hilarious teacher.
Drops your final if you have an A, never opened my book at anytime, will explain if you have an issue, easy A!

I took professor Baily in a summer semester and signed up for another one of his classes in the fall as soon as I could! He is very knowledgable and is crystal clear in his expectations, no curve balls! That being said, you beter take good notes and study them, tests arnt hard, but everythin comes from the lectures. to top it off hes funny as hell!
He's a great instructor and knows his stuff. He breaks things down in normal terms. His test are easy and if you take notes, you will do fine. I didn't crack the book open once.
Awesome Professor extremely "colorful lectures".Tries to be tough but he is a teddy bear. I learned so much about history. I highly recommend taken his class. Three words.I loved it!!!
Mr Bailey is overall a good teacher. Overall, his tests and quizzes are fairly easy. He's a pretty funny guy and will probably make you laugh.
His tests are sometimes hard. You must study for them. Go to class..he doesn't post the notes online and takes attendance everyday. He's keeps you interested. I would recommend him to anyone.
First few tests are easy but dont slack the rest are difficult. His class is interesting but not an easy A. Study for your grade. Take this professor.

Test/quizes started out pretty easy then got ridiculous! You had like 30 names and what each person did then he chose like 20 of them. So if you can't remeber a ton of names and what each one did I don't advise taking his class!  He is however a really cool and fun guy!He made you laugh!

Mr. Bailey is a good teacher. At first, his quizzes (which are about 1 a week) were really easy but I heard he got in trouble with the department and had to make them more difficult. He's really funny if you're not offended by cursing or some obscene remarks. I liked this class but be sure to study. Some things on tests and quizzes aren't in notes.
I love history, but not American history.  For a teacher to make American history interesting and easy to learn for me is a feat.  I really enjoy his class and am looking forward to an A.

Prof Bailey makes it fun to come to class and listen to his lectures, "ya'll." It is a lot of information so take good notes. He gives quizzes only and then a final that comes from the quizzes. Write everything down even if he says you don't need to. They may show up on the quiz. I would take him again.

This professor is very nice till you agitate him.  one student can make hard for whole class.  He is very clear what is expected and he lectures every class.  Take good notes and study those and you will pass.  He at times puts things on a quiz that he did not go over in class and says he did.  so, stand your ground.  he normally fixes prob.

Very nice, super funny.  Gives a quiz after each section.  No tests.  Lots of notes, but all you need is in there for quizzes.  Always lets you out early.  If you have an A at end of semester, no final exam.  Final exam will consist of questions directly from previous quizzes.  Wish all teachers were like him!  LOVE HIM!

Amazing prof Easy quizzes only NO tests Only canceled class twice because he was in the hospital even came to class with throbbing pain NO NEED TO BUY THE TEXTBOOK Only takes attendance for formality sake but if you are late or absent he'll work with you If you have an A you are exempt from the final Loves to teach Watches Hollywood movies in class
Excellant Professor

He is the best professor you could take for this class because the level of thinking/work required is perfect for a gen-ed class. He doesn't treat you like history majors and he doesn't treat you like you're still in high school either. Take notes, study for the quizzes, & you'll do fine.

Whoever posted that earlier probably didn't get a good grade and now are angry because he is crystal clear even telling us what will be word for word on the tests.  He also canceled only 2 times because he was in the hospital.  That is an idiot who doesn't know anything.  This is one of the easiest professors ever.  He only gives quizzes. No tests!

Professor Bailey is ridiculous! "Quizzes" have random stuff you've never heard of and he only has about 6 instead of 10 like he tells you at the beginning. Attendance is mandatory but he lets you out after 45 minutes almost everyday. the best part of this class was we he got shingles and it was canceled like 8 times the semester. avoid him!
Very easy class. Just attend, takes Quizzes. No midterm ot final!

This is the best professor EVER. No tests, all quizzes. Is precise about what will be on the quizzes. No midterm so far. Very funny and interesting. Notes are minimal, barely uses text. Class usually doesn't last full time. Highly recommend this class!
Very clear about what was on tests. Many "tests"...really quizzes. Mostly matching. Easy grade.

HIGHLY Recommend his class!!!  He is an awesome teacher he knows his history and is clear on what he expects.  He lectures and you take notes all of his quizzes come from his notes.  Very helpful and is forgiving on mess ups on his quizzes.  He is super nice. take this class and take good notes and you will get an A.

Amazing prof easiest History professor ever will work with you if you need a makeup test his lectures are easy and he follows a powerpoint that he'll give you if you are a bit slower in class!  Take him if you can as it will definitely be an EASY A even if you aren't a Hist major (I'm not one) he's fun to listen to and U

Amazing professor!  99% of the tests are multiple choice and are amazingly easy!  He will make sure you understand!  We watched Arthur movie for 3 days in class!  If you do the work he'll work with you if you are absent! He's funny and is so easy! I have a hard time in history and this was the easiest History class ever taken! He's amazingly easy!
Straight to the point.  Easy to understand.  No nonsense.

There are no powerpoints, so the quality of information you get from lectures depends entirely upon your ability to take notes. In my three years at KSU, this is my first grade below a B ever, which is absurd because the material is NOT hard. I got an A in my last HIST class. He makes history interesting, but his teaching method blows.

Nice guy,but tends to ramble and jump around in his lectures. His powerpoints are worthless,and his quizzes seemed disorganized. Sometimes would have the student next to you grade your quiz so he didn't have to. If he is the best you can do take him because he is easy if you can follow him,but there are better teachers for this subject

Great guy, has lots of interesting stories, knows the material. Great class as well. about 5-6 Quizzes, Attendance, and Final. Some are exempt from the final depending on your grade before the final. Final has questions from previous tests on them. would recommend !

great class. my class is big so he gives a bunch of small quizzes for grades. pretty funny guy. easy to follow for the most part. gives outlines on the board. made it interesting because he didnt just tell us the facts & he tried to relate it to modern times. would recommend!
I loved this class & He is my favorite teacher even though I'm a psychology major now. I enjoy history & he's very clear on what he wants to cover in class & what to study for the tests/quizes.

The BEST! very sweet, I never liked history until this class. I finally understand and know American History out of all my years of being lectured in high school and elementary....GREAT. EZ to understand, lets you know what you need to know, no tricks, less stress, more learning

This guy is awesome! Everything is like a big, story that connects, and he makes it so interesting and fun! Shows some crazy,action history movies. Quizzes are straight from notes! Study! Gives extra credit. Don't miss class, it is not worth losing the points. He is hilarious and you will learn!

Great Prof.  very clear and is interesting to listen to. Attendance is mandatory but not a problem because he keeps it fun and laid back.  I never got tired or sleepy in his class.  I would highly recommend.

Great professor. He has a great sense of humor and he tells history like a story to keep you interested. All of his quizzes come straight " word for word" from the lecture notes. I would highly recommend him.
Great teacher. Gives quizes for grades, easy if you study. I highly recommend. Hilarious!

Great Professor, very clear lectures. Not exactly the most technologically intelligent, but makes up for lack of computer skills with his easy to follow lectures and his life experiences to compliment the notes. I would take any class he teaches.

Lectures are vague and jump around alot. Speaks more from experience than from the text. Doesn't seem organized,and seemingly administered quizzes differently everytime. More like a guy you would have a beer with than teach you. I like that quality but not in a teacher. If you don't want to teach yourself,don't take him
Awesome professor! Take very detailed notes and study, study, study. Tests were pretty simple...fill in the blank or matching...so you still need to know your stuff. Very helpful. Take him.
Great professor! He really knows his stuff! His lectures are not boring! He tells them like a story. Come to class. Take detailed notes from his outline, and you will be fine! Definitely Recommended!
